title: Which of the early Beatles and Stones albums were the first, not mixed down to mono and were true stereo, not reprocessed? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Beatles and Stones albums were all (well as far as the Beatles were concerned, and I am sure the Stones too) produced in both Mono and True Stereo - not reprocessed stereo, from the start. The first albums mixed only in Stereo and not Mono were Beggars Banquet and Abbey Road, funnily enough, the releases of Banquet and Let it Bleed and Yellow Submarine were actually mixed down to a reprocessed mono.

i am not an expert on stereo/mono questions regarding the Stones, but i can answer on the Beatles: The Beatles, as a band, recorded and mixed all their albums in mono until their final two LPs, Abbey Road & Let It Be. George Martin, their producer, was tasked with creating stereo mixes of their albums without the band’s input. All the Beatles’ albums were released in stereo the same week as the monos, mainly in North America. I would imagine The Rolling Stones also did the same.
